definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
mulberry tree
surname Sang
to scold/to abuse/to curse/CL:通[tong4],頓|顿[dun4]

sentences.english: He had been subject to a campaign of innuendo in the press.
sentences.chinese: 他一直受到新聞界指桑罵槐的影射。

sentences.english: As long as the one void of dust on the ceiling would rather destroy him.
sentences.chinese: 之塵只要一空虛了，就望着天花板指桑罵槐。

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
stupid and ignorant (idiom)
red in the face/extremely angry
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
